words.example_sentence: There are ~many~ stars visible in the clear night sky.

words.definition: The objective case of the first-person singular pronoun referring to the speaker
words.example_sentence: She gave the book to ~me~.

words.definition: that which belongs to the person who is speaking or writing
words.example_sentence: I found a blue pen and realized it was ~mine~.

words.definition: A greater quantity, amount, degree, or number of something
words.example_sentence: I would like some ~more~ coffee please.

words.definition: the greatest amount, quantity, or degree of something
words.example_sentence: She has the ~most~ experience in our team.

words.definition: belonging to or associated with the person who is speaking
words.example_sentence: I need to find ~my~ keys before I can leave.

words.definition: located a short distance away in space or time
words.example_sentence: The grocery store is very ~near~ to our house.

words.definition: Not anything; no single thing; or a state of nonexistence.
words.example_sentence: I opened the box and found ~nothing~ inside.

words.definition: Expressing the relationship between a part and a whole or origin
words.example_sentence: He is the king ~of~ the castle.

words.definition: Physically in contact with and supported by a surface
words.example_sentence: The glass is sitting ~on~ the wooden table.

words.definition: used to link alternatives or options in a choice
words.example_sentence: Would you like tea ~or~ coffee with your breakfast?

words.definition: denoting a person or thing that is different or distinct
words.example_sentence: I have ~other~ plans for the weekend so I cannot go.

words.definition: belonging to or associated with the speaker and one or more others
words.example_sentence: We should take ~our~ dog for a walk in the park.

words.definition: The things belonging to or associated with us
words.example_sentence: That house on the corner is ~ours~.
words.image_term: two hands holding a shared object

words.definition: In or at a position above or higher than something else
words.example_sentence: The plane flew ~over~ the white clouds.

words.definition: Female person or animal previously mentioned or easily identified
words.example_sentence: After ~she~ finished her work, she went for a walk.

words.definition: To a great degree or used to introduce a consequence
words.example_sentence: I am ~so~ happy that you could come to the party.

words.definition: An unspecified amount or number of something
words.example_sentence: I would like ~some~ water with my meal please.

words.definition: An unspecified or unknown person
words.example_sentence: Is ~someone~ knocking at the door?

words.definition: An unspecified or unknown object, fact, or situation
words.example_sentence: I have ~something~ in my pocket for you.

words.definition: Used to introduce the second element in a comparison
words.example_sentence: She is taller ~than~ her brother.

words.definition: Used to identify a specific person, thing, or event previously mentioned
words.example_sentence: I want ~that~ one on the top shelf.

words.definition: A definite article used to refer to specific or previously mentioned things
words.example_sentence: She put ~the~ book on the table.

words.definition: Belonging to or associated with the people or things previously mentioned
words.example_sentence: The students finished ~their~ homework before the bell rang.

words.definition: Refers to two or more people or things previously mentioned or easily identified
words.example_sentence: I looked for my keys but I could not find ~them~.

words.definition: plural form of this, referring to nearby items or people
words.example_sentence: I would like to purchase ~these~ apples please.

words.definition: Used to refer to two or more people or things previously mentioned
words.example_sentence: I saw my friends and ~they~ were laughing together.

words.definition: Refers to a specific person, thing, or event that is nearby
words.example_sentence: I really like ~this~ apple that I am holding right now.

words.definition: The plural form of that, referring to items further away
words.example_sentence: Please bring me ~those~ blue books on the far table

words.definition: moving in one side and out of the other side
words.example_sentence: The train traveled ~through~ the long mountain tunnel.

words.definition: Expressing motion in the direction of a particular location or point
words.example_sentence: She is walking ~to~ the park.

words.definition: in a position below or beneath something else
words.example_sentence: The tired cat is sleeping ~under~ the wooden table.

words.definition: up to the point in time or the event mentioned
words.example_sentence: We waited for the bus ~until~ it finally arrived at noon.

words.definition: To a higher position, level, or greater degree
words.example_sentence: She looked ~up~ at the bright stars in the sky.

words.definition: the objective case of we, used as the object of a verb
words.example_sentence: They invited ~us~ to the dinner party tonight.

words.definition: The speaker and one or more other people considered together
words.example_sentence: Tomorrow ~we~ are going to the beach together.

words.definition: Used to ask for information or specify something that is unknown
words.example_sentence: I do not know ~what~ you are talking about.

words.definition: Used to refer to something previously mentioned when introducing a relative clause
words.example_sentence: This is the car ~which~ I bought last week.

words.definition: A pronoun used to refer to what person or people
words.example_sentence: I want to know ~who~ is coming to the party tonight.

words.definition: The possessive form of who or which used to indicate ownership
words.example_sentence: The girl ~whose~ bike was stolen reported it to the police.

words.definition: Accompanied by or in the company of another person or thing
words.example_sentence: She went to the park ~with~ her best friend.

words.definition: The person or people being addressed by the speaker
words.example_sentence: I hope ~you~ have a wonderful day today.

words.definition: belonging to or associated with the person the speaker is addressing
words.example_sentence: Please remember to take ~your~ keys before leaving the house.

words.definition: that which belongs to the person or people being addressed
words.example_sentence: I found a jacket, is this ~yours~?

words.definition: Reflexive form of you used as the object of a verb
words.example_sentence: You should take some time for ~yourself~ this weekend.
